objects.name: Outpost
objects.description: Strategic points on the map that teams must capture and control.
objects.special_rules: Capture radius ~5-6 units. Each Outpost should have a combat zone buffer of ~12-15 units with cover, flank routes, and obstacles.
objects.source_note: Section 4: Distribution of Outposts & Combat Zone

objects.name: Container
objects.description: Prefab object used as environmental obstacles or cover.

objects.name: Bunker
objects.description: Prefab object used as environmental obstacles or cover.

objects.name: Wall
objects.description: Prefab object used as environmental obstacles or cover.

systems.name: Map Control System
systems.description: System governing the capture and control of Outposts and strategic areas.
systems.mechanics: Teams must capture and hold Outposts to gain advantages. Outposts provide buffs or resources.
systems.objectives: Control majority of Outposts to gain strategic advantage.
systems.source_note: Section 4: Distribution of Outposts & Combat Zone

systems.name: Terrain Buff System
systems.description: System providing buffs based on terrain elevation.
systems.mechanics: Higher terrain provides increased vision range.
systems.objectives: Utilize elevated positions for better tactical advantage.
interactions: Vision buff mechanic tied to terrain height

logic_rules.description: Defines how Outposts are captured and their effects on gameplay.
logic_rules.trigger: Team enters capture radius of an Outpost.
logic_rules.effect: Outpost changes ownership after capture duration. Provides buffs or resources to controlling team.
logic_rules.source_note: Section 4: Distribution of Outposts & Combat Zone

logic_rules.description: Defines how terrain elevation affects vision range.
logic_rules.effect: Increased vision range for tanks on higher ground.

requirements.title: Outpost Accessibility
requirements.description: Ensure all tanks can reach the first Outpost within 75 seconds.
requirements.acceptance_criteria: All tanks from both teams must be able to reach the first Outpost within 75 seconds without feeling left behind.
requirements.source_note: Section 4: Distribution of Outposts & Combat Zone

requirements.title: Choke Point Design
requirements.description: Design 2-3 choke points to naturally direct combat flow.
requirements.acceptance_criteria: Map must include 2-3 choke points that naturally guide combat engagements.
